poem:
"Ploughshares into Protests"

On Teutonic tarmac, tractors stand, 
Defiant rows, tiller-to-tiller under Deutsch sky,
Harvesters of fury, cultivators of demand.
Echoing discontent, we hear their mechanical cry,
Raucous as the raven's warning.
Their unrest blooms, bittersweet, like iron-gorged rye.
On the winds of the far right, a new day is dawning.
Unseen, yet voracious, like rust upon the grain.
Vote, lest the thresher's teeth cut deeper come morning.
